definition: exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: Larry:I'm looking at my schedule and course syllabus for the next semester.
sentences.chinese: 我现在在看我下学期的课表跟课程大纲。

sentences.english: You may take all the Morning Reading directly according to the schedule.
sentences.chinese: 所有晨读课程只需根据课表直接按时参加即可。

sentences.english: Information and communications technology has been on school time tables since 1990.
sentences.chinese: 信息与通讯技术自1990年便登上了学校的课表。

sentences.english: The student schedules are called playlists.
sentences.chinese: 学生课表被称为节目单。

sentences.english: Selecting the Grouping algorithm to solve timetabling.
sentences.chinese: 选用分组算法实现排课表。

sentences.english: Teaches that schedule, not interesting work, is what has value.
sentences.chinese: 教育学生课表，而非有趣的功课，才有价值。

sentences.english: OMG! That schedule sounds insane! Can you drop a class?
sentences.chinese: 你的课表太恐怖了吧，你能不能推一堂？

sentences.english: You may take all the Social Clubs directly according to the schedule.
sentences.chinese: 所有晨读课程只需根据课表直接按时参加即可。

sentences.english: On teacher net result printing system and class schedule inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 教师网上成绩打印系统及课表的查询。

sentences.english: Then you will re-write the paper for submission on the date indicated on the syllabus.
sentences.chinese: 然后各位重写论文初稿并依照课表的日期缴交。

definition: (coll.) to sit in on a class
school begins/give a course/teach a subject
general course/general education course/core course/general curriculum/general education curriculum/core curriculum
to study outside of class time (reviewing one's lessons)/to study in one's free time/individual study
